keyword: how many calories in a white bottle of wine
title: How Many Calories in a Bottle of White Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a white bottle of wine (standard 750 ml), including carbs, alcohol impact, and variations for different styles.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of White Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle, dry white wine (e.g., Sauvignon Blanc), ~12% ABV, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, brand, alcohol content, and serving size. Consult labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry white wine contains about 615 kcal, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of white wine?
faqs.a: About 120-150 kcal per 150 ml glass, depending on the wine.
Dry white wine has low carbs (~0.7 g per 100 ml), mostly from residual sugars.

faqs.q: Why are calories high in a bottle of wine?
faqs.a: Primarily from alcohol (7 kcal/g); a 750 ml bottle at 12% ABV yields ~615 kcal.

faqs.q: How does sweetness affect calories in white wine?
faqs.a: Sweeter wines add 20-50+ kcal per bottle from sugars; dry styles are lower.

faqs.q: Is white wine lower calorie than red?
faqs.a: Similar; both ~82 kcal per 100 ml, but reds may have slightly more from tannins.
